verses.kjv: The priests the Levites, and all the tribe of Levi, shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and his inheritance.
verses.web: The priests and the Levites—all the tribe of Levi—shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel. They shall eat the offerings of LORD made by fire and his portion.
verses.ct: The priests and Levites — the entire tribe of Levi — will receive no land or inheritance among the rest of Israel. Instead, they will live off the food offerings made by fire to the LORD; that is their share.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall they have no inheritance among their brethren: the LORD is their inheritance, as he hath said unto them.
verses.web: They shall have no inheritance among their brothers. LORD is their inheritance, as he has spoken to them.
verses.ct: They won't receive any land inheritance like the other tribes. The LORD himself is their inheritance, just as he promised them.

verses.kjv: And this shall be the priest’s due from the people, from them that offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep; and they shall give unto the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.
verses.web: This shall be the priests’ due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give to the priest: the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the inner parts.
verses.ct: Here is what the priests are entitled to from the people: whenever someone offers an ox or a sheep as a sacrifice, the shoulder, both cheeks, and the stomach must be given to the priest.

verses.kjv: The firstfruit also of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy sheep, shalt thou give him.
verses.web: You shall give him the first fruits of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep.
verses.ct: You must also give him the first portion of your grain, your new wine, your olive oil, and the first wool sheared from your sheep.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God hath chosen him out of all thy tribes, to stand to minister in the name of the LORD, him and his sons for ever.
verses.web: For LORD your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand to minister in LORD’s name, him and his sons forever.
verses.ct: The LORD your God chose the tribe of Levi out of all your tribes to stand and serve in the LORD's name — them and their descendants forever.

verses.kjv: And if a Levite come from any of thy gates out of all Israel, where he sojourned, and come with all the desire of his mind unto the place which the LORD shall choose;
verses.web: If a Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel where he lives, and comes with all the desire of his soul to the place which LORD shall choose,
verses.ct: Now, if a Levite living in any town anywhere in Israel wants to move to the place the LORD chooses as his dwelling,

verses.kjv: Then he shall minister in the name of the LORD his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, which stand there before the LORD.
verses.web: then he shall minister in the name of LORD his God, as all his brothers the Levites do, who stand there before LORD.
verses.ct: he may serve there in the name of the LORD his God, just like all the other Levites who minister before the LORD at that place.

verses.kjv: They shall have like portions to eat, beside that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.
verses.web: They shall have like portions to eat, in addition to that which comes from the sale of his family possessions.
verses.ct: He will receive an equal share of the food with the other Levites, on top of whatever money he has from selling family property.

verses.kjv: When thou art come into the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.
verses.web: When you have come into the land which LORD your God gives you, you shall not learn to imitate the abominations of those nations.
verses.ct: When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you, don't adopt the disgusting practices of the nations already living there.

verses.kjv: There shall not be found among you any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or an observer of times, or an enchanter, or a witch.
verses.web: There shall not be found with you anyone who makes his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, one who uses divination, one who tells fortunes, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer,
verses.ct: No one among you should sacrifice a son or daughter in fire, practice divination, interpret omens, cast spells, or practice sorcery.

verses.kjv: Or a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
verses.web: or a charmer, or someone who consults with a familiar spirit, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
verses.ct: No one should cast charms, consult mediums or spiritists, or try to communicate with the dead.

verses.kjv: For all that do these things are an abomination unto the LORD: and because of these abominations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee.
verses.web: For whoever does these things is an abomination to LORD. Because of these abominations, LORD your God drives them out from before you.
verses.ct: Anyone who does these things is an abomination to the LORD. It's precisely because of these disgusting practices that the LORD your God is driving those nations out ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be perfect with the LORD thy God.
verses.web: You shall be blameless with LORD your God.
verses.ct: You must be completely faithful to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: For these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearkened unto observers of times, and unto diviners: but as for thee, the LORD thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.
verses.web: For these nations that you shall dispossess listen to those who practice sorcery and to diviners; but as for you, LORD your God has not allowed you so to do.
verses.ct: The nations you're about to displace listen to sorcerers and fortune-tellers, but the LORD your God has not allowed you to do that.

verses.kjv: The LORD thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;
verses.web: LORD your God will raise up to you a prophet from among you, of your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him.
verses.ct: The LORD your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people — someone like me. You must listen to him.

verses.kjv: According to all that thou desiredst of the LORD thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.
verses.web: This is according to all that you desired of LORD your God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, “Let me not hear again LORD my God’s voice, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I not die.”
verses.ct: This is exactly what you asked for at Mount Horeb on the day of the great assembly, when you said, "Don't let us hear the voice of the LORD our God or see this enormous fire again, or we'll die!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, They have well spoken that which they have spoken.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “They have well said that which they have spoken.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "What they've said is right.

verses.kjv: I will raise them up a Prophet from among their brethren, like unto thee, and will put my words in his mouth; and he shall speak unto them all that I shall command him.
verses.web: I will raise them up a prophet from among their brothers, like you. I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.
verses.ct: I will raise up a prophet from among their own people, someone like you. I will put my words in his mouth, and he will tell them everything I command him to say.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
verses.web: It shall happen, that whoever will not listen to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
verses.ct: If anyone refuses to listen to the words that prophet speaks in my name, I myself will hold that person accountable.

verses.kjv: But the prophet, which shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, even that prophet shall die.
verses.web: But the prophet who speaks a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die.”
verses.ct: But if a prophet dares to speak a message in my name that I didn't tell him to speak, or speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet must be put to death."

verses.kjv: And if thou say in thine heart, How shall we know the word which the LORD hath not spoken?
verses.web: You may say in your heart, “How shall we know the word which LORD has not spoken?”
verses.ct: You might wonder, "How can we tell whether a message really comes from the LORD or not?"

verses.kjv: When a prophet speaketh in the name of the LORD, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.
verses.web: When a prophet speaks in LORD’s name, if the thing doesn’t follow, nor happen, that is the thing which LORD has not spoken. The prophet has spoken it presumptuously. You shall not be afraid of him.
verses.ct: Here's the test: if a prophet speaks in the LORD's name and what he says doesn't come true, that message wasn't from the LORD. The prophet spoke on his own authority. Don't be afraid of him.
